Closing arguments | The James 'Whitey' Bulger trial

Prosecutor: Whitey Bulger no Robin Hood

Assistant US Attorney Fred Wyshak is summarizing the evidence that prosecutors say proves beyond a reasonable doubt that James "Whitey" Bulger was a fearsome gang leader who rampaged through Boston's underworld in the 1970s and 1980s and was involved in 19 murders. (10:03 a.m.)

  • pictures Scenes from the James 'Whitey' Bulger trial | Complete coverage of the Bulger trial

Church official allegedly hired prostitute

Monsignor Arthur Coyle, 62, an episcopal vicar for the Archdiocese of Boston, plead not guilty this morning after he was allegedly found with a prostitute behind a cemetery. (12:11 p.m.)

Baby among 14 rescued from sinking boat

Crews rescued four adults and 10 children, including a four-month-old baby, after their boat began sinking off Cohasset.
 (10:24 a.m.)

Crowds go crazy for Comic Con

(Samantha Laine for Boston.com)
Comic book enthusiasts of all ages came out in droves to the Seaport World Trade Center this weekend for the 2013 Boston Comic Con.

bond at Cape program

Tablet shipments slow down with no new iPad, research firm says
